
\color{blue}

**Solution**:


Let $\vec{y}$ be the column vector $(y_1, \dots, y_n)$ of average SAT scores in each of the $n=50$ states.
Define the column vector of coefficients as $\vec{b} = (b_1, b_2)$. 
Let $\mat{X}$ be the design matrix defined above. 
We obtain $\vec{b}$ using the equation.
\[
\vec{b} = (\mat{X}^\transpose \mat{X})^{-1}\mat{X}^\transpose\vec{y}
\]
